(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: update_new_synced_metrics()] [Race Condition] If this function is called concurrently while storage is being updated, can reading highest_synced_version race with concurrent commits causing metrics to skip versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: update_new_synced_metrics()] [Negative Values] If num_synced_transactions is 0, does incrementing by 0 have any side effects on metric aggregation or can it be used to probe metric state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Proof Validation] Is proof_ledger_info validated before being passed to storage_synchronizer, or can an invalid proof cause transactions to be executed against the wrong ledger state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Epoch Boundary] If end_of_epoch_ledger_info is provided, is it properly validated to ensure it represents a valid epoch transition, or can malicious epoch-end proofs cause network forks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Error Recovery] If execute_transactions() fails after partial execution, are uncommitted transactions rolled back, or can partial state changes persist causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Notification Metadata] Does notification_metadata get properly validated, or can malicious metadata values cause the storage synchronizer to mishandle the execution request? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Gas Accounting] Are gas costs properly validated during transaction execution, or can transactions with incorrect gas costs be executed causing economic attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: execute_transactions()] [Signature Validation] Does the execute_transactions call verify all transaction signatures before execution, or is signature validation assumed to be done elsewhere, potentially allowing unsigned transactions? [File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/utils.rs] [Function: apply_transaction_outputs()] [Output Count Mismatch] Does get_num_outputs() correctly count all outputs including events and state changes, or can a mismatch cause incorrect state application and divergence? (High)
